intro: Colquhounia seguinii var. seguinii, commonly known as the Seguin's colquhounia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, evergreen leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
